nanoparticles were prepared via a reported one-
). Briefly, chloroauric acid was first mixed with tetra-
methanol to form Au(I)-SR polymers. Then, Au(I)-SR was reduced
by sodium borohydride (aqueous solution) to form nanoparticles.
After a size-focusing process lasting for ~4.5 hours, the precipitated
product was washed with methanol and isolated using PTLC. The
product was confirmed by ESI-MS (see fig. S1).
Triangular prism-like single crystals were grown by vapor diffusion
of acetonitrile into a toluene solution of the purified nanoparticles
over 1 week at room temperature (fig. S2). As a close comparison,
the same manner but were unfortunately unresolvable (fig. S3), similar
shows a similar atomic structure as that of Au
ing to powder XRD (fig. S4). More experimental details are given in

(DCM)] shows two prominent peaks at 355 and 715 nm, with two
inconspicuous humps at 475 and 595 nm (fig. S5), indicating the

are more distinct than the solution of the
molecule impurities not identified by mass spectroscopy (see fig. S1).

belongs to the trigonal crystal system and adopts
value of 5.98%; see tables S1 and S2).
Such a highly symmetrical packing is not seen in other nanoparticle
crystals, except for that of Au
particles form a 6H left-handed helical arrangement (

lize in a triclinic or monoclinic space group (

The as-obtained structure has high symmetry with 6
fig. S6, similar to the Pd
except for the following distinct differences: (i) the central vacancy,
which reduces the metal atom count from 145 to 144, and (ii) the
profound chirality in the outermost shell(s). The crystal structure
matches the model proposed by Lopez-Acevedo, especially the most
shells), resembling the traditional â€œfootballâ€ of Asia, although the
) symmetry imposed by the unit cell was not shown (
This level of agreement between the calculations and the experiment
is remarkable. The magnitude of the chirality is also very close to
the calculation from the model structure by Pelayo
worth noting that the theoretical modeling of this structure type, as
used to account for many observed properties of Au
related systems, was motivated directly by the Pd
) because of the agreement in the
powder XRD patterns obtained on the samples, along with the

but rather assumed its correctness, and attempted to refine it using
the DFT methods, which were finally efficient enough to optimize
such a large system. Below, we discuss the details of the structure of
As shown in Fig.Â 2A, the inner shell is a hollow 12-atom ico-
sahedron. This is the first experimental observation of a hollow ico-
) in thiolated gold nanoparticles, although a similar
in gold, silver, palladium, and platinum nanoclusters (
A plausible speculation of the central vacancy is that the hollow
structure significantly relieves the intrinsic strain associated with the
). With regard to the analogous Pd
the palladium atom with its smaller size may accommodate the
intrinsic strain. However, unexpectedly, even for the similar-sized
which prompts the following question: How can a single gold atom
enter the center of the hollow Au

) Parallel hexahedron unit cell containing a pair of enantiomers. The
